metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24303 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Pillow before 9.0.1 allows attackers to delete files because spaces in temporary pathnames are mishandled.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Further commits in 9.1 removed deleting the temporary files completely, not sure what the impact of using the below 3 commits are on older releases, will they introduce a regression that got fixed in 9.1?

criterions.comment: pillow: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
